DOC.HEADLINE: BRIEFLY : OTHER NEWS
DOC.TEXT: Jury Awards $ 28.6 Million for Asthma Drug Damage : The award went_to a man who suffered brain damage after using a common asthma drug made by Key Pharmaceuticals Inc. , a subsidiary of Schering-Plough Corp . of Madison , N.J. Paul R . Bocci III , 24 , lost his short-term_memory ability as a result of a toxic reaction to the drug , Theo-Dur . According to evidence at a trial in Portland , Ore. , Key Pharmaceuticals sold the drug without adequately informing doctors about problems associated with its use . Schering-Plough criticized the verdict and said it plans to appeal .
